title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A story about the American Dream and the Roaring Twenties.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: Explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A classic romance novel featuring Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime and surveillance society.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: Follows the journey of Captain Ahab and his obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: Narrates the experiences of Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
summary: A bildungsroman following the life of Jane Eyre, an orphaned governess.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A fantasy novel detailing the adventures of Bilbo Baggins and a group of dwarves.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: A science fiction novel exploring themes of ambition, creation, and humanity.

title: Hamlet
author: William Shakespeare
summary: A tragedy about the Prince of Denmark and his quest for revenge against his uncle.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
summary: An epic poem detailing the adventures of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
summary: A horror novel featuring Count Dracula and the battle between him and a group of vampire hunters.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A philosophical novel exploring themes of beauty, morality, and the corruption of the soul.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy following the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
summary: Follows the adventures of Huck Finn and his friend Jim, a runaway slave, as they travel down the Mississippi River.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
summary: A Gothic romance novel featuring the tragic love story of Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
summary: Set in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts, the novel explores themes of sin, guilt, and redemption.

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
summary: A surreal and fantastical tale following Alice's adventures in a magical world.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
summary: A classic adventure novel depicting the revenge plot of Edmond Dantès, who escapes from prison to enact vengeance against those who wronged him.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
summary: Set during the Great Depression, the novel follows the Joad family as they migrate from the Dust Bowl to California in search of a better life.
